content.title: Resilient, Responsive, and Caring Staff
content.description: Support for and management of staff; staff culture; hiring and onboarding.
content.mainContent: Monument Academy’s leadership team employs a purposeful human capital strategy, striving to recruit, develop and sustain our highly resilient, responsive, and caring staff.

content.title: Deep connections with family and community
content.description: Families are honored as partners and experts.
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, we are invested in partnering with parents and stakeholders in the community to ensure that all of our students receive all necessary supports.

content.title: Appealing and relevant physical space
content.description: Purposeful design, use of space, and ongoing care for the physical environment.
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, the design, use, and ongoing care of our physical space plays an essential role in enabling our model to meet the physical, academic, and socio-emotional needs of all of our students.

content.title: Smooth and service-oriented operations
content.description: Administration and operations function in service to students, families, and educators.
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, administration and operations function in service of students, families and educators.

content.title: Supportive and embedded partnerships
content.description: Deep, aligned partnerships with nonprofit, public and private sector organizations.
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, our work is enabled by deep, aligned partnerships with nonprofit, public safety and private sector organizations.

content.title: Proactive management of safety and risk
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, our approach to strategy and risk management is to limit, avoid, transfer, and accept varying degrees of risk through partnering with our insurance broker.

content.title: Excellent school governance
content.description: Best-in-class board structure and policies; transparent organization structure.
content.mainContent: At Monument Academy, the board of directors is responsible for overseeing the contract of the CEO, reviewing and approving the budget, and ensuring the school is meeting or exceeding its academic and other performance goals.
